description: Numbers n for which n-th primorial + square of (n+1)-th prime is also a prime.
comments: r = prime(n+1)^2 is the smallest possible composite number that, if added to the n-th primorial, might give a prime.
formula: a(n) = A002110(n) + prime(n+1)^2 is prime; n so that A054758(n)=1.
example: a(5)=6, 6th primorial is 30030, square of 7th prime is 289, sum gives 30319, a prime. No more were found below 200.
author: _Labos Elemer_, May 04 2000
